word_mean: 大黄：大黄的干燥根茎和根，其流浸膏及酊剂用作泻药，常见的庭园大黄(R. rhaponticumL.)可以食用且无泻素

sentence.Network_en: Make an infusion by boiling and simmering the rhubarb and camomile together.
sentence.Network_cn: 将大黄和甘菊一起煮沸再用文火炖，熬成汤药。

sentence.Network_en: I had rhubarb tart with a lot of cream.
sentence.Network_cn: 我吃了添加了许多奶油的大黄小馅饼.

sentence.Network_en: Effects and Symptoms: The rhubarb itself, is harmless and even healthy.
sentence.Network_cn: 效果和症状: 大黄本身是无毒无害甚至是有益健康的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting the rootstock of other plants of this genus used medicinally): from Old French reubarbe, from a shortening of medieval Latin rheubarbarum, alteration (by association with rheum 'rhubarb') of rhabarbarum 'foreign rhubarb', from Greek rha (also meaning 'rhubarb') + barbaros 'foreign'

entry.def: Rhubarb is a plant with large leaves and long red stems. You can cook the stems with sugar to make jam or puddings.

means.word_mean: 1. long pinkish sour leafstalks usually eaten cooked and sweetened
2. plants having long green or reddish acidic leafstalks growing in basal clumps; stems (and only the stems) are edible when cooked; leaves are poisonous
